label: 官司請負
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a modern historiographical term denoting the practice of “contracting out” (請負) official posts to specific families or lineages, which led to increasing hereditization. Many historians see this practice as characteristic of Japan’s medieval society and polity, beginning in mid-to-late Heian times.
